intro: Scorzoneroides × jouffroyi, commonly known as the hybrid snowdrop, is a perennial herbaceous plant that belongs to the genus Scorzoneroides in the family Amaryllidaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in woodland habitats and prefers moist, well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, rounded bulbs for propagation. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
